question: Q1. What is the name of the organelle depicted in the image?
Q2. What is the primary function of mitochondria?
Q3. Which part of the mitochondrion is responsible for housing the electron transport chain and ATP synthase?
Q4. What is the role of mitochondria in calcium homeostasis?

options.a: Regulate calcium ion concentration within the cell
options.b: Store excess calcium ions for later use
options.c: Transport calcium ions to the nucleus
options.d: Convert calcium ions into usable energy

question: Q5. What is a unique feature of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA)?

options.a: It is housed in the nucleus of the cell.
options.b: It is similar to bacterial DNA.
options.c: It is passed down only from the mother's side.
options.d: It is responsible for producing mitochondria-specific proteins.
